Class CriticalSection

java.lang.Object
WorkLoad.CriticalSection
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable
public class CriticalSection extends Object implements Comparable
Represents a critical section usage within a task's job.

A CriticalSection records which shared resource is used, its relative start/end times (relative to the job or task), and derived execution time. It also supports nesting: a CriticalSection can belong to a Nest, reference an outside critical section, and contain inner critical sections.

Inline Chinese comments in the original code are preserved and the Javadoc integrates their meaning: for example, useSharedResource is the resource being used, relativeStartTime and relativeEndTime denote start and end times, and executionTime is calculated from those times. This class implements Comparable to allow ordering by relative times (used by priority queues or sorting).

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Method Details

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Object o)
      Compare this CriticalSection to another by relative start time, then by relative end time. This ordering is used to sort or prioritize critical sections within job/task analyses.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable
      Parameters:
      o - the other CriticalSection to compare against (expected type)
      Returns:
      negative if this begins earlier than o, positive if later; when start times are equal the longer end time sorts before the shorter (consistent with original logic)
      Throws:
      ClassCastException - if o is not a CriticalSection

    • setUseSharedResource

      public void setUseSharedResource(SharedResource r)
      Assign the shared resource used by this critical section.
      Parameters:
      r - the SharedResource instance used in this critical section

    • setRelativeStartTime

      public void setRelativeStartTime(long t)
      Set the relative start time of this critical section.
      Parameters:
      t - the start time relative to the job or task timeline

    • setRelativeEndTime

      public void setRelativeEndTime(long t)
      Set the relative end time of this critical section and update the derived execution time (end - start).
      Parameters:
      t - the end time relative to the job or task timeline

    • getExecutionTime

      public long getExecutionTime()
      Get the computed execution duration of this critical section.
      Returns:
      execution time = relativeEndTime - relativeStartTime

    • getOutsideCriticalSection

      public CriticalSection getOutsideCriticalSection()
      Get the enclosing (outside) critical section if this is nested.
      Returns:
      the outside CriticalSection or null when this is top-level
